factText: Disaster relief is underway in Nashville and other parts of Tennessee following Tuesday’s deadly tornado and storms that claimed at least 24 lives. The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, is collecting money to support relief efforts for areas affected by this week’s deadly tornadoes in Middle Tennessee.

An East Nashville couple and at least five young children were among those killed when two powerful tornadoes touched down in Tennessee this week. Multiple tornadoes touched down on Tuesday morning and shattered parts of Nashville. A total of four tornados touched down early Tuesday morning. Convoy of Hope was in Nashville less than 24 hours after two devastating tornadoes touched down in middle Tennessee.

Metro Nashville Schools to Remain Closed for the Remainder of the Week—Thursday (3/5) and Friday (3/6) as the city continues to respond to the devastation caused by the tornado. The Monthly Middle Tennessee Victim Support Group that was previously scheduled for tonight, March 5, in Nashville has been cancelled due to tornado damage in the area.

Risk modelling firm Corelogic said that the tornado outbreak that struck the Nashville, Tennessee area on March 3rd are likely to cause $1 billion or more of property damage once the impact is fully assessed.

The tornadoes have claimed at least 24 lives. At least 24 dead after tornado rips through Nashville and central Tennessee - NBC News https://apple.news/AZkcq4FlETsm3iIVOGCY7VQ. As you may have seen on the news, powerful tornadoes hit Nashville and other parts of Tennessee on Tuesday, killing at least 24 people. Strong tornadoes in Tennessee over the past week have caused 24 deaths. At least 25 people are dead, 18 from Putnam County, after tornadoes struck Middle Tennessee on March 3.

Tornadoes can often happen in the middle of the night, so make sure you have at least two ways to receive the warnings. Tennesseans Urged to Use Caution When Giving to Tornado Victims NASHVILLE, Tenn. –. 3/5 ALERT: Tornado damage in the Nashville area continues to periodically affect phone service at some of our hospitals and clinics.

TVA crews are coming to the rescue in Nashville following tornado devastation early Tuesday. There are over 5,000 volunteers already mobilized to help in these efforts alongside MNA, but the OMPC Disaster Response Team stands ready to respond when needed. Right now fire and rescue crews are rapidly working throughout our communities.

A tornado WARNING or EMERGENCY means TAKE ACTION. People across Nashville were awakened by outdoor sirens warning of the tornado danger early Tuesday. First violent tornado in NWS Nashville forecast area since 4/10/2009 (Good Friday tornado).

The EF-4 tornado that killed dozens in the Nashville area of Tennessee is confirmed to have remained on the ground for more than 50 miles. It stayed on the ground for 53.4 miles. Picture of the Tornado , When it touched down the clouds you see around it came down to the ground also and stayed on the ground for 50 miles killing over 25 people and still some people missing. The tornado was on the ground for about an hour -- traveling more than 50 miles!!
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_How long did the tornado stay on the ground during {event}?

factText: Knoxville TDOT Strike Force crews are headed to Nashville to help with tornado cleanup efforts. They've headed to Nashville to help all those impacted by tornadoes. NASHVILLE TORNADO RELIEF: Earlier this morning, we responded to the devastation of the Nashville tornadoes by sending vans to Nashville to rescue homeless pets in the affected areas.

In the wake of devastating tornadoes that hit Davidson, Putnam and Wilson counties, Secretary of State Tre Hargett is urging people to use caution when trying to help those affected. The tornado that devastated Nashville and Middle Tennessee has created even more need. They are in desperate need of some items after the devastating tornado ripped there community apart😭. The deadly #tornado that struck #Tennessee and #Nashville and other cities, was on the ground for over 50 miles.

Unfortunately, there has been massive damage throughout a large area surrounding our ROC, including road closures and downed power lines. Buildings are flattened, cars are buried in debris, the power is out until further notice, and, tragically 24 lives have been lost.
The affected stretch of US Highway 70 is still closed to traffic. No one allowed on these streets right now except for official response crews and media

Only relief workers and residents are being allowed in the affected area. Emergency alert systems seem to have functioned as designed in Nashville on Tuesday morning. Ten students and 6 staff members have been displaced because of damage to their homes. Reports keep trickling in about students and families who are displaced.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: Many lost their homes and are staying in shelters or hotels. Those who can’t stay in or find local hotels are staying with family or in shelters. They will offer free, temporary housing to those who need it!. We are offering a 40% discount on our RV sites and cabins through the end of March to anyone who has been displaced by the storms or individuals who are coming to Nashville to help with the disaster relief and cleanup.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_general_Where can displaced people find emergency housing?

factText: Tornado relief efforts are underway, led by local organizations including Hands On Nashville, The Community Foundation of Middle Tennessee, Gideon's Army, and Community Resource Center. Nashville Mayor, Hands On Nashville announced plans for organized tornado damage clean-up efforts this weekend. Education reporter Bobbie Hayse speaks with local school officials about their emergency preparedness plans, a timely topic in light of Tuesday's tornado in Tennessee.

With help from the Midday 180 on 104.5 the Zone, Cumulus Media and more, we are going to make a big push tomorrow to drive support for all of those affected by the tornados. One Stone Church, Worship City Alliance, Somebody Cares, Crisis Response International and hundreds of local church volunteers have joined hands to bring relief to the victims of the East Nashville Tornado.

Weather forecasters still working to survey damaged areas, especially in Putnam County, said Wednesday a single tornado caused about 50 miles of damage across Davidson, Wilson and Smith counties in Middle Tennessee. Logistics facilities in Mount Juliet close to Nashville, Tennessee have been severely damaged by the tornado which hit the community on March 3rd. Crews are still surveying the damage in Putnam County, where an EF-4 tornado hit.
Schools are closed for the rest of the week, and cleanup efforts are continuing to restore power and clear the roads. Still mostly cleanup work, most of the roadways are cleared.

The cleanup continues in parts of central Tennessee following a deadly tornado outbreak . Crews are out in Nashville working to clean up after the tornado left a path of destruction: https://bit.ly/2TrkWTy:=:https://fox17.com/news/local/nashville-devastation-395-homes-184-businesses-majorly-damaged-or-destroyed-in-tornado. Crews with the Nashville Electric Service have made significant progress restoring power to impacted Middle Tennessee communities following the deadly tornadoes.

The path of the tornado that hit Nashville and points east was 50 miles long. The NWS Nashville Tornado survey confirms the EF-3 tornado that struck Nashville, TN and many other communities was on the ground for 53.4 MILES and had a path width of 800 yards. The Nashville, TN tornado has been upgraded to an EF4 with an estimated updated path of ~83km (path still preliminary), causing 88 injuries and 18 deaths. The width of that monster tornado was nearly 1/2 mile at one point!
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_What was the path length and width of the tornado?

factText: The hangar at Tune Airport collapsed on top of her when the tornado came through (last pic). In the wake of a powerful tornado that sliced through Nashville's Joh C. Tune Airport, officials there continue to sift through the wreckage.

Eater Where to support local by dining out in the heaviest hit areas, as others await power and repairs As severe storms and a 50-mile-long tornado ripped right through Nashville early this week while many slept, a growing list of over 40 restaurants around town are closed due to damage and loss of power.

CMT, the American Red Cross and local NBC affiliate WSMV News 4, Nashville are teaming up March 5 for a Nashville tornado relief telethon. #NashvilleStrong Hatching Hope will be collecting donations for the victims of the tornado in middle Tennessee at both locations Friday March 6th & Saturday March 7th 9am-5pm only.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_general_What volunteer efforts are currently active for {event}?

factText: The Enhanced Fujita Scale or EF Scale, used since 2007, is the National Weather Service’s method to rate tornadoes.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_What is the Fujita scale rating for the tornado in {event}?

factText: We believe this period will feature an uptick in severe weather reports including potentially strong tornadoes. From the Nashville NWS preliminary damage survey Wednesday night.. "Two very damaging tornadoes occurred across Middle Tennessee during the early morning hours of March 3, 2020, resulting in widespread damage and numerous injuries and fatalities. Today's #frontpage: More #tornado danger looms in #March; Fuel leak forces area road closures; #Trial date set for #Gilleland
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_Are meteorologists predicting more tornadoes following {event}?

factText: The Memphis Vet Center staff and Mobile Vet Center (MVC) are in Mt. Juliet and Lebanon, Tennessee taking part in recovery efforts from the tornado that hit middle Tennessee on Tuesday.

Thousands of people are giving their time, their homes, their money, and their love to all those impacted by this week's tornado. Earlier this week, devastating tornadoes ripped across Nashville and Middle Tennessee taking 25 lives, injuring many residents, and damaging or destroying homes, businesses, buildings and more. Sadly, at least 24 people lost their lives during the tornado and many more lost everything in a matter of minutes.
Gander RV is collecting the following items to deliver to the victims of this weeks horrific tornadoes in the Nashville, TN area: Hygiene Supplies (ie. toothpaste, soap, shampoo, etc) Work Gloves
All the communities affected by the horrific tornado and storms earlier this week WILL rebuild, and the WILL thrive.

Tornado Debris Guidelines for Metro Residents ⬇️⬇️⬇️ As you begin cleaning up from the March 3rd tornado, make sure to follow these preliminary guidelines to ensure your debris is collected: All items and materials MUST be separated into three different piles and placed at the curb or street side for collection. TENNESSEE TORNADO DAMAGE: A lot of schools in the Nashville area were damaged following Tuesday morning's tornado.

🚨 The Nashville Lifestyles Magazine's Love Stories event that was scheduled for tonight has been canceled due to the unfortunate and tragic situation in Nashville due to the tornado that hit that community the other day. Due to the tornado that ripped through the Nashville area earlier this week, Friday's episode has been canceled.

VA NDR is looking for volunteers to travel to Nashville to assist with the tornado damage. Local volunteers with Sheep Dog Impact Assistance are heading to Nashville to help with tornado cleanup. Here a couple of locations sponsored by the Central Labor Council of Middle TN for anyone who would like to volunteer to help with the tornado relief efforts this weekend. Our Virginia District Rapid Response Team is looking for volunteers to assist with the tornado damage in Nashville, Tennessee.

With the help of partners, Red Cross disaster volunteers opened six shelters following the deadly Tennessee tornadoes, where more than 105 people spent Wednesday night. I am devastated by how many people in the Nashville community have been displaced and have endured extensive damage as a result of the tornado early Tuesday morning.

24 people are dead and 3 are still missing after an EF-4 tornado hit Tennessee. More than three dozen people are still unaccounted for, while hundreds of structures suffered damage. A tornado ripped across Tennessee killing several people and causing many to go missing. There are still three people missing and there are now 25 fatalities. These are the people lost this week during the Middle Tennessee tornado

The Salvation Army is on the ground in Tennessee helping those affected by the tornado. Operation Compassion Responds to Nashville Metro and Cookeville Tornadoes: Currently, OPERATION COMPASSION-A Ministry of Blessings is establishing four disaster relief sites. Operation BBQ Relief is set up in Nashville to prepare hot bbq meals for those displaced by the F-3 tornado.

At least 24 people are dead in the wake of the tornadoes. The tornado caused significant damage including 48 collapsed buildings and 33,000 homes without power. The death toll from the tornado has risen to 26, another 200 have suffered injuries, and nearly 50 buildings have collapsed in the Nashville area as search and rescue continues. Due to the Nashville tornadoes, over 18,000 homes remain without power.

The city of Nashville, as well as Mount Juliet and Cookeville (and surrounding communities) have been severely effected by the tornadoes. They will be departing quickly after 2pm headed to the areas around Cookeville hit by this week's F-4 tornado. Federal assistance is coming to three Tennessee counties with major disaster declarations after Tuesday's deadly tornadoes. The recent tornado outbreak caused devastation across middle Tennessee, and adjoining areas.

Gov. Brian Kemp has declared a State of Emergency for all Georgia counties south of I-20 due to flooding and severe weather. After two days of heavy rains, Conference leaders are monitoring flooding in South Georgia. The riverfront recreation areas on both sides of the river begin to be inundated.

U.S. National Weather Service (NWS) has confirmed it was an EF-4 tornado with wind speeds reaching 175 mph. The National Weather Service office in Nashville said Wednesday night the twister that struck Putnam County was an EF-4 tornado with wind up to 175 mph that killed 18 people and injured 88 in that county. The tornado that destroyed portions of Nashville, TN was on the ground for over 50 miles, and rated a EF-3 (winds up to 165 mph).
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_What was the estimated wind speed of the tornado?

factText: The historic Church of the Assumption in Nashville’s Germantown neighborhood was one of a number of churches and other buildings that suffered significant damage early March 3 when a tornado cut a swath of destruction through the city that stretched for miles.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_How many structures were completely destroyed due to {event}?

factText: If you are interested in donating to the Tornado Relief efforts the Franklin Visitor Center is looking for more: bottled water, reusable shopping bags, peanut butter, pop-top cans of tuna, chicken, fruits, and vegetables. DCA is also asking for supplies such as heavy duty trash bags, boxes, tarps, tape guns, furniture dollies, sharpies, flashlights, batteries, energy bars, and water.
The Holy Spirit is offering “Storm Warnings” for those who have ears to hear.

Dean Flener Thurs., March 5, 2020 OFFICE: 615-741-0430 Federal Assistance Comes to Three Tennessee Counties with Major Disaster Declaration from Deadly Tornadoes Individuals with Damage in Davidson, Putnam, & Wilson Counties can Register Now for FEMA Individual Assistance www.disasterassistance.gov:=:https://www.disasterassistance.gov/ NASHVILLE, Tenn. –

Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee announced this afternoon Davidson, Wilson, and Putnam counties will receive federal aid through an expedited Major Disaster Declaration as a result of the deadly March 3, 2020, tornadoes and severe weather. President Trump has approved a major disaster declaration for Tennessee to provide federal aid to tornado survivors ahead of his scheduled visit to Nashville on Friday.

If you are outside during a tornado warning, the best option is to drive to a designated shelter, basement or safe room. The Franklin Visitor Center is collecting donations for the tornado relief!. Home improvement retailer Lowe’s will hold tornado relief events across Middle Tennessee Thursday for victims of the deadly tornadoes. The Legal Aid Society’s clinics are available to all those impacted by the tornadoes.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_Tornado_What emergency shelters are open specifically for tornado victims?

factText: Four tornadoes have been found in Middle Tennessee from March 3rd!. From the NWS in Tennessee: BREAKING-SURVEY UPDATE: Four tornadoes have been found in Middle Tennessee from March 3rd!. Four tornadoes have been found in Middle TN from March 3rd Nashville EF-3 (165mph): 60.13 miles/800 yards Smith/Putnam EF-0 (75mph): 5.88 miles/50 yards Cookeville EF-4 (175mph): 8.21 miles/500 yards SE Cookeville/Goffton EF-0 (75mph): 0.23 miles/25
Law enforcement made their second looting arrest in the tornado-damaged area. We’re glad they are able to respond so quickly and effectively to the areas damaged in the path of the tornado.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-018_general_What actions are being taken by law enforcement to ensure safety during {event}?
